body.p:
I am duly in receipt of
your esteemed favor bearing date of the 3d
inst this morning and regret that I am
in possession of the desired information
that might otherwise delay an immediate
answer. Our mutually valued friend Alfred
T. Jones Esq. wrote us a very eloquent letter some
time since in reference to the subject you have
ably advocated and the trial we then made
to obtain loans from our co-religionist re-
-sulted only in upraidings and derision.

Not I assure you without just cause. The
congregation to which we belong is in debt
to the amount of $2000. for building & balance
of money due on lot It consists of only 20
members upon whom from the beginning
all the responsibility and liability has
devolved. We have been but recently threat
-ened with a suit of ejectment which
caused us all to bleed to our uttermost pe
-cuniarily the poorest among us advancing
a $100. but we still have the heavy
burden of $2000 hanging o'er our necks
and weighing us down with more

or less anxiety. Under these circumstances the idea
of contributing to the aid of others is almost scow-
-led at, however charity-like. But this arises from
a two-fold reason, first our own burdens, secondly
the remembrance of the treatment we received
when we made an appeal to our brethren
in Philadelphia and N.Y. where our mission-
ary or rather messenger after spending a
whole month succeeded in raising only the
paltry sum of $160. Think of the mighty cities
of N. Y. & Phila combinedly giving only $160!
A private donation would have amounted to
more if actuated by the proper spirit and
ability! No, my dear Sir I regret to say
there is not the slightest prospect of raising
a dollar in aid of the laudable object you
warmly advocate, it would be a great source
of happiness to me to be the means in however
slight a manner to assist our co-religionists
in Phila to place you at the head of a prosperous congre-
gation, but lacking the necessary power I must
be placed among those of your friends who
have all the will but none of the ability.

Your return to the ministry will be
warmly hailed by your brethren throughout
the Union and considered by all your true
friends as an eventual triumph. How grati

-fying
it must be to you after so many long years to
once more and that to in Philadelphia assume
the exalted office it has been your destiny to
so ably fill, permit me to congratulate you.

I cannot express to you the real plea-
sure—the very thought of your return affords
to my heart, believe me I hail it with no
ordinary emotions of pride and gratification
of course at present perhaps forever the “Advo-
-cate” will be abandoned—your ministerial
duties and your editorial not permitting ad
-ditional—at least at present, perhaps it is
as well, the generation to come will be a more
intelligent one. I mean of our people in this
country, and they will require a literature
of their own. I shall forthwith consti-
tute myself your active agent here for your
admirable journal the occident and as
meet “our people” weekly now at the lodge,
being a member of the I.O.BB. I shall have
opportunities which shall not be lost. I
begin by sending you the name of
D. Cauffman to whom from 1st of May
you may send the Occident for one year
I shall exert myself in your further
behalf in this respect on every occasion
and the pleasure of this aiding to

disseminate the doctrines promulgated in you
through your journal, will be “sweet recompense
for all my labors.” It may be that I may
in some of my “inspired moments” send
you a fledgling for the grave columns of
the Occident but it will much depend
upon “time” and the “will” to do anything
that smacks of literary recreation or labor.

Your friends here who esteem you so warm
-ly beg me to assure you of the gratification
your return to the pulpit will afford
them. Both Mr & Mrs Davis desire (with
my Brother & ?) to be kindly
remembered. Thank God our little ones
have come through the “fire & water” of their
recent long & painful not to say serious
sickness in safety the gloom that has
so long hung over our household is fast
disappearing under the blessed and
benigrant? rays of returning Health & Sunshine
With renewed assurances of esteem and
regard believe me
